update.description:
* Added unitint, unitfloat, and unitstr to auxiliary.py to store unit information
    along side primitive values.

    Altered xml.XML._handle_param to use these unit-storing primitives. Reads unit
    information.

    Updated unit tests for mzml and mzid to check that unit_info fields are populated.

* Added parser for the "duration" xsd type that returns a unitfloat("minute").
    Updated mzxml schema to use this new converter for "retentionTime". Corrected
    the converter for precursorMz@precursorCharge attribute definition in mzxml schema
    too.

* Updated test_mzxml to check that "retentionTime" properly converts units
    using the new duration parser. Updated data.mzxml_spectra's retentionTime
    fields to use minutes instead of seconds.

* Added handling of BOM in ByteCountingXMLScanner
update.title: Implementation of described work in " cvParam Unit Awareness"

pull_request.title: Implementation of described work in " cvParam Unit Awareness"

content.raw: Further testing suggests no new issues have been introduced, and that `_repr_pretty_` will display unit names for values in the `dict` objects produced by `XML.get_info` when they're `display`ed in a Jupyter Notebook.
content.html: Further testing suggests no new issues have been introduced, and that _repr_pretty_ will display unit names for values in the dict objects produced by XML.get_info when they're displayed in a Jupyter Notebook.

pull_request.title: Implementation of described work in " cvParam Unit Awareness"

pullrequest.title: Implementation of described work in " cvParam Unit Awareness"

content.raw:
I've offloaded the behavior to `_repr_pretty_` so that at least IPython will show the unit. Not ideal, but it beats making this a breaking change.

Unfortunately, I don't think a mixin would work since we're depending upon the builtin's `__repr__` which is part of a specific inheritance path, which would not be on the mixin's MRO. A metaclass wouldn't work here, since the behavior we're using is about class instances, not the classes themselves or instance creation.

I also noticed that during my testing of the mzXML retention time change that scans were coming out out of order for non-nested scans. I rewrote the queue iterator to use a priority queue instead of trying to traverse the tree myself.
content.html:
I've offloaded the behavior to _repr_pretty_ so that at least IPython will show the unit. Not ideal, but it beats making this a breaking change.

Unfortunately, I don't think a mixin would work since we're depending upon the builtin's __repr__ which is part of a specific inheritance path, which would not be on the mixin's MRO. A metaclass wouldn't work here, since the behavior we're using is about class instances, not the classes themselves or instance creation.

I also noticed that during my testing of the mzXML retention time change that scans were coming out out of order for non-nested scans. I rewrote the queue iterator to use a priority queue instead of trying to traverse the tree myself.

pullrequest.title: Implementation of described work in " cvParam Unit Awareness"

content.raw:
So we change neither `repr` nor `str`?
That makes the change unnoticable to the vast majority of the users. But I have no objections.

P.S. Strange, I thought I'd left a comment here earlier today, but it's not there now. In the comment I was asking if we want to use a common mixin or metaclass for the unit types. I can play around with that later though.
content.html:
So we change neither repr nor str? That makes the change unnoticable to the vast majority of the users. But I have no objections.

P.S. Strange, I thought I'd left a comment here earlier today, but it's not there now. In the comment I was asking if we want to use a common mixin or metaclass for the unit types. I can play around with that later though.

pull_request.title: Implementation of described work in " cvParam Unit Awareness"

pullrequest.title: Implementation of described work in " cvParam Unit Awareness"

content.raw: It appears that some database connectors like psycopg2 serialize things with `repr` and not `str`. For that reason, I should not include the unit information in the `__repr__` method of the unit-values. Agree?
content.html: It appears that some database connectors like psycopg2 serialize things with repr and not str. For that reason, I should not include the unit information in the __repr__ method of the unit-values. Agree?
